etymology.description: Pictogram (象形); different theories exist; see also 旦
etymology.interpretation: Often explained as the silhouette of a nail or spike, or a simple vertical post with a cap-like head. Its extremely simple form was later borrowed to label the fourth Heavenly Stem, and by administrative extension it came to denote an adult male for census/tax purposes.

examples.chinese: 甲乙丙丁是天干的前四位(甲乙丙丁是天干的前四位)。
examples.pinyin: Jiǎ Yǐ Bǐng Dīng shì tiāngān de qián sì wèi.
examples.english: Jiǎ, Yǐ, Bǐng, Dīng are the first four of the Heavenly Stems.

examples.chinese: 他出生在丁亥年(他出生在丁亥年)。
examples.english: He was born in the year of Dīnghài.

examples.chinese: 本县有三千丁(本縣有三千丁)。
examples.pinyin: Běn xiàn yǒu sān qiān dīng.
examples.english: This county has three thousand adult males.
